Groton Memorial Town Forest

Summary

524.0 Acres, Trails 13.5 miles, 21.7 km

Allowed Activities

Swimming, Fishing, Getting Lost, Hiking, Mountain Biking, Equestrian, Cross Country Skiing, Snowshoeing

Prohibited Activities

Motorized use is prohibited

Property Owner

Groton Town Forest Committee

Parking

Town Forest Road, Groton MA
Google Maps, Apple Maps

Hours

Sunrise to Sunset. Sunrise Time , Sunset Time

Links

NEMBA Groton Town Forest, Groton Town Forest Race, Town Forest Committee

Trail Maintenance

Groton Trail Committee. Please email gtc@grotontrails.org to report problems.

Description

The Groton Memorial Town Forest was established in 1922 as a memorial to the men who gave their lives in World War I. It is owned by the town of Groton, and is managed by the Town Forest Committee. It is one of the more popular places in Groton to enjoy the outdoors, offering plenty of space to explore and beautiful views of the Nashua River. The site has a large variety of trails that are excellent for leisurely strolls, mounting biking, horse back riding, dog walking, and nature watching. It is also the site of the annual Groton Town Forest Race.

The parking lot at the end of town forest road has plenty of space and has a turning circle for horse trailers.

Please take personal protection measures to reduce your exposure to ticks and mosquito bites, Please pick up after your dog and do not feed, approach or touch wildlife, including waterfowl.

Please send us your photos of the Groton Memorial Town Forest!

gtc@grotontrails.org |
